Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: du

Arguments.Name: a
Arguments.Description: Display an entry for each file in a file hierarchy

Arguments.Name: c
Arguments.Description: Display a grand total

Arguments.Name: H
Arguments.Description: Symbolic links on the command line are followed, symbolic links in file hierarchies are not followed

Arguments.Name: h
Arguments.Description: "Human-readable" output.  Use unit suffixes: Byte, Kilobyte, Megabyte, Gigabyte, Terabyte and Petabyte

Arguments.Name: g
Arguments.Description: Display block counts in 1073741824-byte (1-Gbyte) blocks

Arguments.Name: k
Arguments.Description: Display block counts in 1024-byte (1-Kbyte) blocks

Arguments.Name: m
Arguments.Description: Display block counts in 1048576-byte (1-Mbyte) blocks

Arguments.Name: I
Arguments.Description: Ignore files and directories matching the specified mask

Arguments.Name: mask
Arguments.Description: mask

Arguments.Name: L
Arguments.Description: Symbolic links on the command line and in file hierarchies are followed

Arguments.Name: r
Arguments.Description: Generate messages about directories that cannot be read, files that cannot be opened, and so on.  This is the default case.  This option exists solely for conformance with X/Open Portability Guide Issue 4 (``XPG4'')

Arguments.Name: P
Arguments.Description: No symbolic links are followed.  This is the default

Arguments.Name: d
Arguments.Description: Display an entry for all files and directories depth directories deep

Arguments.Name: depth
Arguments.Description: depth
depth
depth
depth

Arguments.Name: s
Arguments.Description: Display an entry for each specified file.  (Equivalent to -d 0)

Arguments.Name: x
Arguments.Description: Display an entry for each specified file.  (Equivalent to -d 0)

Arguments.Name: files
Arguments.Description: files
